verses.verse: (Praise for God’s Goodness and Might) Praise the LORD! Praise the name of the LORD; give praise, O servants of the LORD,
(Ps 92.13; Lk 2.37) you who stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.
(Ps 119.68; 147.1) Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; sing to his name, for he is gracious.
(Ex 19.5; Deut 7.6, 7; 10.15; 1 Pet 2.9) For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel as his own possession.
(Ps 48.1; 97.9) For I know that the LORD is great; our Lord is above all gods.
(Ps 115.3) Whatever the LORD pleases he does, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all deeps.
(Job 38.22; Jer 10.13) He it is who makes the clouds rise at the end of the earth; he makes lightnings for the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
(Ex 12.12; Ps 78.51) He it was who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both humans and animals;
(Ps 78.43) he sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
(Num 21.24) He struck down many nations and killed mighty kings—
(Num 21.21-26, 33-35) Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
(Ps 78.55) and gave their land as a heritage, a heritage to his people Israel.
(Ex 3.15; Ps 102.12) Your name, O LORD, endures forever, your renown, O LORD, throughout all ages.
(Deut 32.36) For the LORD will vindicate his people and have compassion on his servants.
(Ps 115.4-8) The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
They have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
they have ears, but they do not hear, a nose, but there is no breath in their mouths.
Those who make them and all who trust them shall become like them.
(Ps 115.9) O house of Israel, bless the LORD! O house of Aaron, bless the LORD!
(Ps 118.4) O house of Levi, bless the LORD! You who fear the LORD, bless the LORD!
(Ps 134.3) Blessed be the LORD from Zion, he who resides in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!
